page.title: 06Edingale Village School
page.content: The village school is called the Mary Howard Primary and is at present controlled by the Staffordshire Education Committee having previously been a Church of England foundation. There are 35 children on roll whose ages range from 4 to 11. They are taught by two full-time teachers and one part-time, and other help is given with music. All basic subjects are taught and the pupils also have the opportunity to play a musical instrument,learn to swim and do computer studies. There has been a school in Edingale for well over a hundred years and it used to be housed in accomodation belonging to the listed building next to the present school.
